title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: The ascent of the hill, which is neither difficult nor dangerous, may be made from Holyrood Palace by crossing  the Queen's Park, aud then either taking the footpath leading past St. Anthony's Well, with St. Anthony's Chapel on the left ; or by following the Queen's Drive, commencing at the northern base of the hill to the point presenting the easiest access to the summit. This is reached at a tarn called Dunsapie Loch, the edge of which is skirted by the road.
